oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Intercropping – the application of ecological principles in organic plant production
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jensen, Erik Steen
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop husbandry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A general lecture on organic goals and principles regarding research. How to utilise principles of organic farming among research groups as well as among farmers, advisors, educators and students. The introduction of initiates from DARCOF preparing a discussion document, which treats some of the fundamental principles and values of the organic movement and analyses the use of different technologies in organic farming and food processing is the startint point for discussion.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Jensen, Erik Steen (2002) Intercropping – the application of ecological principles in organic plant production. Speech at: Course in Organic farming, University of Western Australia, Perth, Australia, 8 October.
